text: Tynna (), possibly also known as Dana, was a town of ancient Cataonia or of southern Cappadocia mentioned by Ptolemy. It was located in the neighbourhood of Faustinopolis, and inhabited through Roman times. Its site is located near Zeyve, Porsuk, Asiatic Turkey. ==References== Category:Populated places in ancient Cappadocia Category:Populated places in ancient Cataonia Category:Former populated places in Turkey Category:Roman towns and cities in Turkey Category:History of Niğde Province
title: Tynna
